conbody.p: The second method currently supported is via our batch ingest method which is extremely fast. Secure FTP or an ssh connection is configured to enable a source system to write data to a temporary landing space in PHEMI Central. Currently, this temporary data file is a Sequence file which is a specific distributed file format, which the file transfer process must support -- either through use of PHEMI's helper functions & scripts, or client developed.

A bulk ingest process is then triggered (schedule or remotely) which launches a Map-Reduce job that inserts the bulk data into PHEMI Central at a very fast rate. The temporary files are then purged from the system.
